natural problem: Johnny has 7 different colored marbles in his bag.  In how many ways can he choose three different marbles from his bag to play a game?
natural solution: He can choose 3 marbles from 7 distinct marbles in $\binom{7}{3}=\boxed{35}$ ways.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat and C :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. C n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
and h1 : "n = 7"
and h2 : "k = 3"
shows  "C n k = 35"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Johnny has 7 different colored marbles in his bag.  In how many ways can he choose three different marbles from his bag to play a game? The final Answer is 35
 ### Proof
 He can choose 3 marbles from 7 distinct marbles in $\binom{7}{3}=\boxed{35}$ ways.
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat and C :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n k. C n k = fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k))"
and h1 : "n = 7"
and h2 : "k = 3"
shows  "C n k = 35"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the number of combinations of choosing 3 items from a set of 7 items. The final answer is 35.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 7"
shows  "n choose 3 = 35"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Johnny has 7 different colored marbles in his bag.  In how many ways can he choose three different marbles from his bag to play a game? The final Answer is 35
 ### Proof
 He can choose 3 marbles from 7 distinct marbles in $\binom{7}{3}=\boxed{35}$ ways.
 *)

theorem
fixes n :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 7"
shows  "n choose 3 = 35"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: What is the number of combinations when choosing 3 items from a set of 7 items? The final answer is 35.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes choose :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "choose = (\<lambda>n k. fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k)))"
shows  "choose 7 3 = 35"
a_3.formal solution:

 ### Proof

fixes choose :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat"

shows  "choose 7 3 = 35"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k r :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 7"
and h1 : "k = 3"
and h2 : "r = nchoosek n k"
shows  "r = 35"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Johnny has 7 different colored marbles in his bag.  In how many ways can he choose three different marbles from his bag to play a game? The final Answer is 35

 *)

theorem

and h2 : "r = nchoosek n k"
shows  "r = 35"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
